name: 02 - Data Description
content:
Data Description

The solution integrates multiple data sources, each capturing a distinct view of retail operations:

  • Transactions: Detailed household purchase records including items, quantities, prices, discounts (manufacturer, campaign, in-store), coupon flags, timestamps, and payments.
  • Households: Demographics (age, income, marital status, homeownership, household size, presence of children).
  • Campaigns: Metadata (ID, description, duration).
  • Coupons: Coupon-to-product and campaign mappings.
  • Coupon Redemptions: Household-level logs of coupon redemption events.
  • Products: Metadata (manufacturer, department, brand, commodity/sub-commodity classification, package size).
  • Product Reviews: Ratings, text reviews, timestamps — supporting sentiment analysis.

Data Types:

  • Numerical: Price, quantity, discount amounts, household income.
  • Categorical: Demographics, product attributes, campaign IDs.
  • Temporal: Transaction timestamps, campaign start/end dates, redemption day.
  • Textual: Review comments.

Granularity:

  • Household–day–transaction level for behavior analysis.
  • Product–campaign level for promotion tracking.
  • Household-level for demographics and clustering.

Data Preparation

The preparation phase ensured data quality and readiness for modeling:

1. Cleaning:

  • Missing demographics imputed with statistical or mode-based filling.
  • Erroneous prices/quantities corrected or dropped.
  • Deduplication of coupon-product mappings.

2. Feature Engineering:

  • Behavioral features: visit frequency, median basket size, discount sensitivity, repeat purchase ratio.
  • Campaign features: number of campaigns exposed, redemption ratio.
  • Demographic features: income brackets, household size categories.
  • Sentiment features: review polarity and intensity scores.

3. Transformation:

  • Encoding categorical variables (brands, marital status, etc.).
  • Normalizing skewed numerical values (prices, spend).
  • Text preprocessing (tokenization, sentiment scoring, TF-IDF).
